definition:
[ **-**]{} A subset $Y$ of a topological space $X$ is said to be
[**locally closed**]{} if it is the intersection of an open and a closed
subset.

The following result provides some definitions:

[ **-**]{} The following are equivalent:

1.  $Y$ is locally closed in $X$.

2.  Each point in $Y$ has an open neighborhood $U \subseteq X$ such that
    $U \cap Y$ is closed in $U$ (with the subspace topology).

3.  $Y$ is open in its closure $\overline{Y}$ (with the subspace
    topology).
